net.sourceforge.aglets.itinerary
Interface Itinerary

All Known Subinterfaces:
CircularItinerary, SimpleItinerary, TaskItinerary
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseCircularItinerary, BaseCircularTaskItinerary, BaseItinerary, BaseRandomItinerary, BaseTaskItinerary
public interface Itinerary

This interface defines the generic type for an itinerary. An itinerary is a collection of destination for one or more agents. The itinerary provides facilities to move the agent along its trip and to get/set the next/previous/current location.

Version:
1.0 13-set-2005
Author:
Luca Ferrari - cat4hire@users.sourceforge.net

          Returns information about the current location of the agent.
 int getDestinationCount()
          Returns the number of destination contained in this itinerary.

          Returns the first address of the collection contained in this itinerary.
 java.lang.String getLastDestination()
          Returns the last destination address contained in this itinerary.
 int getRemainingDestinationCount()
          Provides information about the number of destinations not visited yet.
 void goToNextDestination()
          The main and most important method of the itinerary.
 void setImmutable()
          Once this method is called, the itinerary will no more be modifiable, that means there will be no way to add/remove a destination from this itinerary.
 void skipNext()
          This method allows an agent to skip the next destination of this itinerary, that means the next destination becomes the one following the current next one.
 

Method Detail

getDestinations

java.util.Iterator getDestinations()
Gets the list of destinations.

Returns:
the iterator with the list of destinations stored, at the moment, in the itinerary.

setImmutable

void setImmutable()
Once this method is called, the itinerary will no more be modifiable, that means there will be no way to add/remove a destination from this itinerary.

getFirstDestination

java.lang.String getFirstDestination()
Returns the first address of the collection contained in this itinerary.

Returns:
the first destination of this itinerary.

getLastDestination

java.lang.String getLastDestination()
Returns the last destination address contained in this itinerary.

Returns:
the last destination string of this itinerary.

getCurrentLocation

java.lang.String getCurrentLocation()
Returns information about the current location of the agent. This method does not provide the next destination, but the destination the agent should be depending on this itinerary.

Returns:
the current location of the agent, as URI string as stored in this itinerary.

getDestinationCount

int getDestinationCount()
Returns the number of destination contained in this itinerary.

Returns:
the size of this itinerary, that means the total number of destination contained in this itinerary.

getRemainingDestinationCount

int getRemainingDestinationCount()
Provides information about the number of destinations not visited yet.

Returns:
the number of destinations not yet visited during this itinerary.

skipNext

void skipNext()
This method allows an agent to skip the next destination of this itinerary, that means the next destination becomes the one following the current next one. It is like the internal destination index is incremented of one location.

goToNextDestination

void goToNextDestination()
The main and most important method of the itinerary. It force the agent to move to the next destination of this itinerary. If there is not the next destination in this itinerary, nothing happens (but the itinerary is supposed to provide the same information about the current location).
